item.title: Error ellipses
item.description: In order to graphically convey error corellation in the isotope data, error ellipses must be constructed from measured coordinates in isotope ratio space, the measurement error on each isotope ratio, and the associated error corellation. This code calculates the proper coordinates for the error ellipse (default 95% confidence interval). In addition, there is a function to calculate the ‘best fit’ distance to a fitted isochron, to evaluate the misfit of each data point.

item.title: Yorkfit
item.description: Implementation of the standard isochron method emplyoed by ISOPLOT (e.g. Ludwig, 2003) as defined in York 1966, 1969 York et al. 2014. The method uses two measured variables with correlated errors.
